p: In the regions of occurrence of the Ornithodoros ticks, a pigâ€“tick transmission cycle is also observed. Therefore particular vigilance should be maintained even after the eradication of the disease from a specific pig population. Ticks can contribute to the long-term persistence of the virus in the environment, which may lead to new outbreaks of the disease. An example of this is the outbreak of ASF in Portugal in 1999 on a farm where ASF had already appeared in the past ( 5).
